TopicTitle: Phantom forces affecting plane rotation on reentry to lower atmosphere

Articles.Content:
Quicksave https://www.dropbox.com/s/y0gx99pld7zx41u/quicksave.sfs?dl=0

So i was just returning from a mission where i rescued a kerbal from kerbin LKO and a guy from Minmus. After aerobreaking a few times I came in for final approach. the plane was reacting fine the entire time since take off; Upon reaching low altitude, 6k, i ejected rear rocket engines (while less then 22 away from runway) to make the plane more stable and recover the parts later. It still has jets. once below 5k, i get massive roll issues. the craft seems perfectly balances, and has acted that way since mission take off, but it seems to roll in on direction like a wing or aileron has been taken off, but i can see no visible damage to the craft. It would not remain airborne and i deployed emergency parachutes to save the crew members. the quick save loads right when i was starting to feel the problem, shortly after ejecting rocket engines.

Could someone take a look or help me understand why this is happening? i have tested this craft for tens of hours getting it perfected and i got it there, but for some reason phantom forces are at work on it.

Thank you for your time
